title: Bug 116744: Dynamic text content type has no effect
OB: When I set the Dynamic Text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report displays the same results.
EB: The expected behavior is that when I set the Content Type property to Plain, the literal content (tags and all) should be displayed. When set to Auto, the content 1, 2, and 3 should appear properly without HTML or RTF tags. When set to HTML, content 1 and 2 should appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 should appear literally with RTF tags.
SR:
1. Open the attached report.
2. Set the Dynamic Text element's Content Type property to Plain.
3. Verify that the literal content is displayed.
4. Set the Content Type property to Auto.
5. Verify that content 1, 2, and 3 are displayed properly without HTML or RTF tags.
6. Set the Content Type property to HTML.
7. Verify that content 1 and 2 are displayed properly without HTML tags, and content 3 appears literally with RTF tags.
